channel.title: Update Messages
channel.description:
What files am I missing? I've edited the Mudclient.java, Server.java, CommandHandler.java, PlayerLogin.java, MiscPacketBuilder.java, and the timer works fine when executed. However, when logging out and back in, the dumb fucking thing isn't displaying on the client anymore but the timer is still running.
Did I miss a file?

item.title: Update Messages
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

[quote=“Peeter, post:31, topic:333029”][quote author=bengina link=topic=429452.msg3154590#msg3154590 date=1268901421]
When telling someone on these forums where to look if you were to tell them the server class they would come back saying " i’ve looked everywhere and cant find it, I dont have it in my server", where as if you were to say server.java then they have a better chance of finding it.

You are correct in what you are saying but most of the people you are saying it to are 12 year old kids that dont know their arse from their elbow. Its better to include the extension rather than adding class as to minimize confusion for them.


[/quote]

Indeed that is correct. But I was correcting people who are already familiar with the Java language.[/quote]
That is also correct.

Read full topic

You are correct in what you are saying but most of the people you are saying it to are 12 year old kids that dont know their arse from their elbow. Its better to include the extension rather than adding class as to minimize confusion for them.

:D[/quote]

Indeed that is correct. But I was correcting people who are already familiar with the Java language.

item.title: Update Messages
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

[quote=“Peeter, post:28, topic:333029”]Again, it has nothing to do with the extension of the file (.CLASS and .JAVA are file extensions).
public final class mudclient extends GameWindowMiddleMan {
It’s the mudclient class, as you define it. You don’t say ArrayList.JAVA, why would you say Mudclient.java?[/quote]
Why argue, I mean it is the proper term, but the language is JAVA so he was referring it to what he has done in that language (.java). .Class is the compiled form of JAVA obviously, but he was just saying/asking what files he has dealt with.

I guess the flaming was not necessary (not just from you…) and I know you were just trying to prove/show what the proper term was, but he was just in the section for a question, not a war.

Read full topic

item.title: Update Messages
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

When telling someone on these forums where to look if you were to tell them the server class they would come back saying " i’ve looked everywhere and cant find it, I dont have it in my server", where as if you were to say server.java then they have a better chance of finding it.

You are correct in what you are saying but most of the people you are saying it to are 12 year old kids that dont know their arse from their elbow. Its better to include the extension rather than adding class as to minimize confusion for them.

item.title: Update Messages
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

yong min:

Like I said, tell someone who gives a shit. It was totally clear, but i’ll call it however I want to call it. Show me the rule where it says it must be called .CLASS.

Again, it has nothing to do with the extension of the file (.CLASS and .JAVA are file extensions).

public final class mudclient extends GameWindowMiddleMan {

It’s the mudclient class, as you define it. You don’t say ArrayList.JAVA, why would you say Mudclient.java?

Read full topic

item.title: Update Messages
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:11, topic:333029”][quote author=Peeter link=topic=429452.msg3153964#msg3153964 date=1268836732]

Just a side note, stop calling class names “Player.java” or “mudclient.java”. They’re the Player class, mudclient class etc etc etc.

.JAVA is simply an extension.

Sorry, but who actually gives a shit?

It’s simply the correct(er) way of doing it.

FYI, at a grand scale, no-one gives a shit what you do with your life, yet you still try to live it to the max.
[/quote]

Regardless of the correcter way of writing .CLASS or .JAVA, nobody cares. If it irritates you that much, set it up so it replaces .JAVA with .CLASS. Perhaps that would make you happy?

I pity anyone who doesn’t live life to the max, so why don’t you step out into the real world and start living yours to the max?

[edit] Oh, and FYI, I did state that it was fixed, so why not do your job and lock this thread, instead of picking up on something that really ISN’T important.[/quote]

It has nothing to do with the extension of the filename…

public final class mudclient extends GameWindowMiddleMan {

Instead of turning aggressive, you should ask if something is unclear for you.

Read full topic
